field.label: Enable proxy
field.help: Enable or disable the proxy service.

field.label: User error pages
field.help: The proxy error pages can be altered, default layout uses OPNsense content, when Squid is selected the content for the selected language will be used (standard squid layout), Custom offers the possibility to upload your own theme content.

field.label: ICP port
field.help: The port number where Squid sends and receives ICP queries to and from neighbor caches. Leave blank to disable (default). The standard UDP port for ICP is 3130.

field.label: Enable access logging
field.help: Enable access logging.

field.label: Access log target
field.help: Send log data to the selected target. (when syslog is selected, facility local 4 will be used to send messages of info level for these logs)

field.label: Enable store logging
field.help: Enable store logging.

field.label: Ignore hosts in access.log
field.help: Type subnets/addresses you want to ignore for the access.log.

field.label: Use alternate DNS-servers
field.help: Type IPs of alternative DNS servers you like to use.
field.hint: Type IP addresses, followed by Enter or comma.

field.label: Enable DNS v4 first
field.help: This option reverses the order of preference to make Squid contact dual-stack websites over IPv4 first. Squid will still perform both IPv6 and IPv4 DNS lookups before connecting. This option will restrict the situations under which IPv6 connectivity is used (and tested) and will hide network problems which would otherwise be detected and warned about.

field.label: Use Via header
field.help: If set (default), Squid will include a Via header in requests and replies as required by RFC2616.

field.label: X-Forwarded-For header handling
field.help: Select what to do with X-Forwarded-For header. If set to: "on", Squid will append your client's IP address in the HTTP requests it forwards. By default it looks like X-Forwarded-For: 192.1.2.3; If set to: "off", it will appear as X-Forwarded-For: unknown; "transparent", Squid will not alter the X-Forwarded-For header in any way; If set to: "delete", Squid will delete the entire X-Forwarded-For header; If set to: "truncate", Squid will remove all existing X-Forwarded-For entries, and place the client IP as the sole entry.

field.label: Visible Hostname
field.help: This is the hostname to be displayed in proxy server error messages.

field.label: Administrator's Email
field.help: This is the email address displayed in error messages to the users.

field.label: Suppress version string
field.help: Suppress Squid version string info in HTTP headers and HTML error pages.

field.label: Connection Timeout
field.help: This can help you when having connection issues with IPv6 enabled servers. Set a value in seconds

field.label: Whitespace handling of URI
field.help: Select what to do with URI that contain whitespaces. The current Squid implementation of encode and chop violates RFC2616 by not using a 301 redirect after altering the URL.

field.label: Memory Cache size in Megabytes
field.help: Enter the cache memory size to use or zero to disable completely.

field.label: Enable local cache
field.help: Enable or disable the local cache. Only UFS directory cache type is supported. Do not enable on embedded systems with SD or CF cards without the /var MFS option as this will wear down your drive.

field.label: Cache size in Megabytes
field.help: Enter the storage size for the local cache (default is 100).

field.label: Cache directory location
field.help: Enter the directory location for the local cache (default is /var/squid/cache).

field.label: Number of first-level subdirectories
field.help: Enter the number of first-level subdirectories for the local cache (default is 16).

field.label: Number of second-level subdirectories
field.help: Enter the number of first-level subdirectories for the local cache (default is 256).

field.label: Maximum object size (MB)
field.help: Set the maximum object size (default 4MB when left empty).

field.label: Enable Linux Package Cache
field.help: Enable or disable the caching of packages for linux distributions. This makes sense if you have multiple servers in your network and do not host your own package mirror. This will reduce internet traffic usage but increase disk access.

field.label: Enable Windows Update Cache
field.help: Enable or disable the caching of Windows updates. This makes sense if you don't have a WSUS server. If you can setup a WSUS server, this solution should be preferred.

field.label: Enable traffic management.
field.help: Enable or disable traffic management.

field.label: Maximum download size (kB)
field.help: Enter the maximum size for downloads in kilobytes (leave empty to disable).

field.label: Maximum upload size (kB)
field.help: Enter the maximum size for uploads in kilobytes (leave empty to disable).

field.label: Overall bandwidth throttling (kbps)
field.help: Enter the allowed overall bandtwith in kilobits per second (leave empty to disable).

field.label: Per host bandwidth throttling (kbps)
field.help: Enter the allowed per host bandwidth in kilobits per second (leave empty to disable).

field.label: Enable Parent Proxy
field.help: Enable parent proxy feature.

field.label: Host
field.help: Parent proxy IP address or hostname.

field.label: Port
field.help: Parent proxy port.

field.label: Enable Authentication
field.help: Enable authentication against the parent proxy.

field.label: Username
field.help: Set a username if parent proxy requires authentication.

field.label: Password
field.help: Set a password if parent proxy requires authentication.

field.label: Local Domains
field.help: List of domains not to be sent via parent proxy.

field.label: Local IPs
field.help: List of IP addresses not to be sent via parent proxy.

field.label: Proxy interfaces
field.help: Select interface(s) the proxy will bind to.

field.label: Proxy port
field.help: The port the proxy service will listen to.

field.label: Enable Transparent HTTP proxy
field.help: Enable transparent proxy mode. You will need a firewall rule to forward traffic from the firewall to the proxy server. You may leave the proxy interfaces empty, but remember to set a valid ACL in that case. Add a new firewall rule

field.label: Enable SSL inspection
field.help: Enable SSL inspection mode, which allows to log HTTPS connections information, such as requested URL and/or make the proxy act as a man in the middle between the internet and your clients. Be aware of the security implications before enabling this option. If you plan to use transparent HTTPS mode, you need nat rules to reflect your traffic.Add a new firewall rule

field.label: Log SNI information only
field.help: Do not decode and/or filter SSL content, only log requested domains and IP addresses. Some old servers may not provide SNI, so their addresses will not be indicated.

field.label: SSL Proxy port
field.help: The port the ssl proxy service will listen to.

field.label: CA to use
field.help: Select a Certificate Authority to use. To create a CA, go to CA Manager.

field.label: SSL no bump sites
field.help: Create a list of sites which may not be inspected, for example bank sites. Prefix the domain with a . to accept all subdomains (e.g. .google.com).

field.label: SSL cache size
field.help: Enter the maximum size (in MB) to use for SSL certificates.

field.label: SSL cert workers
field.help: Enter the number of ssl certificate workers to use (sslcrtd_children).

field.label: Allow interface subnets
field.help: When enabled the subnets of the selected interfaces will be added to the allow access list.

field.label: FTP proxy interfaces
field.help: Select interface(s) the ftp proxy will bind to.
field.hint: Type or select interface (Leave blank to disable ftp proxy).

field.label: FTP proxy port
field.help: The port the proxy service will listen to.

field.label: Enable Transparent mode
field.help: Enable transparent ftp proxy mode to forward all requests for destination port 21 to the proxy server without any additional configuration.

field.label: Allowed Subnets
field.help: Type subnets you want to allow access to the proxy server.

field.label: Unrestricted IP addresses
field.help: Type IP addresses you want to allow access to the proxy server.

field.label: Banned host IP addresses
field.help: Type IP addresses you want to deny access to the proxy server.

field.label: Whitelist
field.help: Whitelist destination domains. You may use a regular expression, use a comma or press Enter for new item. Examples: "mydomain.com" matches on "*.mydomain.com"; "^https?:\/\/([a-zA-Z]+)\.mydomain\." matches on "http(s)://textONLY.mydomain.*"; "\.gif$" matches on "\*.gif" but not on "\*.gif\test"; "\[0-9]+\.gif$" matches on "\123.gif" but not on "\test.gif"

field.label: Blacklist
field.help: Blacklist destination domains. You may use a regular expression, use a comma or press Enter for new item. Examples: "mydomain.com" matches on "*.mydomain.com"; "^https?:\/\/([a-zA-Z]+)\.mydomain\." matches on "http(s)://textONLY.mydomain.*"; "\.gif$" matches on "*.gif" but not on "\*.gif\test"; "\[0-9]+\.gif$" matches on "\123.gif" but not on "\test.gif"

field.label: Block browser/user-agents
field.help: Block user-agents. You may use a regular expression, use a comma or press Enter for new item. Examples: "^(.)+Macintosh(.)+Firefox/37\.0" matches on "Macintosh version of Firefox revision 37.0"; "^Mozilla" matches on "all Mozilla based browsers"

field.label: Block specific MIME type reply
field.help: Block specific MIME type reply. You may use a regular expression, use a comma or press Enter for new item. Examples: "video/flv" matches on "Flash Video"; "application/x-javascript" matches on "javascripts"

field.label: Allowed destination TCP port
field.help: Allowed destination TCP ports, you may use ranges (ex. 222-226) and add comments with colon (ex. 22:ssh).

field.label: Allowed SSL ports
field.help: Allowed destination SSL ports, you may use ranges (ex. 222-226) and add comments with colon (ex. 22:ssh).

field.label: Enable ICAP
field.help: If this checkbox is checked, you can use an ICAP server to filter or replace content.
field.hint: Select if you want to use ICAP.

field.label: Request Modify URL
field.help: Enter the url where the REQMOD requests should be sent to.
field.hint: Enter the URL of the ICAP Server

field.label: Response Modify URL
field.help: Enter the url where the RESPMOD requests should be sent to.
field.hint: Enter the URL of the ICAP Server

field.label: Default Options TTL
field.help: Default ttl

field.label: Send Client IP
field.help: If you enable this option, the client IP address will be sent to the ICAP server. This can be useful if you want to filter traffic based on IP addresses.
field.hint: Send the client IP address to the ICAP server.

field.label: Send Username
field.help: If you enable this option, the username of the client will be sent to the ICAP server. This can be useful if you want to filter traffic based on usernames. Authentication is required to use usernames.
field.hint: Check if the username should be sent to the ICAP server.

field.label: Encode Username
field.help: Use this option if your usernames need to be encoded.
field.hint: Check if you want to encode the username using base64.

field.label: Username Header
field.help: The header which should be used to send the username to the ICAP server.
field.hint: Enter the name of the header.

field.label: Enable Preview
field.help: If you use previews, only a part of the data is sent to the ICAP server. Setting this option can improve the performance.
field.hint: Enable if you want to use previews.

field.label: Preview Size
field.help: Enter the size of the preview which is sent to the ICAP server.
field.hint: Enter the size of the preview.

field.label: Exclusion List
field.help: Exclusion list destination domains.You may use a regular expression, use a comma or press Enter for new item. Examples: "mydomain.com" matches on "*.mydomain.com"; "https://([a-zA-Z]+)\.mydomain\." matches on "http(s)://textONLY.mydomain.*"; "\.gif$" matches on "\*.gif" but not on "\*.gif\test"; "\[0-9]+\.gif$" matches on "\123.gif" but not on "\test.gif"

field.label: Authentication method
field.help: Select Authentication method

field.label: Enforce local group
field.help:
Restrict access to users in the selected (local)group.
NOTE: please be aware that users (or vouchers) which aren't administered locally will be denied when using this option.

field.label: Authentication Prompt
field.help: The prompt will be displayed in the authentication request window.

field.label: Authentication TTL (hours)
field.help: This specifies for how long (in hours) the proxy server assumes an externally validated username and password combination is valid (Time To Live). When the TTL expires, the user will be prompted for credentials again.

field.label: Authentication processes
field.help: The total number of authenticator processes to spawn.

field.label: Enable SNMP Agent
field.help: Enable or disable the squid SNMP Agent.

field.label: SNMP port
field.help: The port number where Squid listens for SNMP requests. To enable SNMP support set this to a suitable port number. Port number 3401 is often used for the Squid SNMP agent.

field.label: SNMP password
field.help: The password for access to SNMP agent
